alert.note: Alert for Eastern Pima-Southeastern Pinal-Santa Cruz-Western Cochise; Mountains above 5500 feet; Southern Graham-Central and Eastern Cochise-Southern Greenlee-Lower Elevations of the San Carlos Apache Nation in Graham County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 02 at 12:38PM MST until March 04 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RH, AND A HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR PARTS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 151, 152, AND 154... * AFFECTED AREA...Southeast half of fire weather zone 151, southern two thirds of fire weather zone 152 and the southeast east part of fire weather zone 154 including the Dragoon, Mule, Huachuca and Chiricahua mountains. * TIMING...Late Friday morning through Friday afternoon. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts 35 to 40 mph in the watch area. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum RH 11 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop or are ongoing will have the potential to spread rapidly in the dry light fuels under these forecast conditions. * FOR A DETAILED VIEW OF THE HAZARD AREA...Visit weather.gov/Tucson and click on the Detailed Hazards Icon.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of the Fire Weather Watch for portions of Southeast Arizona.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Pima-Southeastern Pinal-Santa Cruz-Western Cochise; Mountains above 5500 feet; Southern Graham-Central and Eastern Cochise-Southern Greenlee-Lower Elevations of the San Carlos Apache Nation in Graham County
